data.title: Hometown Press, Author at Hometown Press
data.text:
Recent Posts by Hometown Press

Noun Harder honored with Iowa Bankers Association Student Athlete Achievement Award

Corder Noun Harder, a senior at Lynnville-Sully High School, was honored as the 2024 Class 1A recipient on Mar. 8 of the Iowa Bankers Association’s Student Athlete Achievement Award during the Iowa High School Boys Basketball State Tournament in Des Moines. The award recognizes a graduating senior student-athlete who not only excels in athletics, but...

Lynnville United Fund raises $1,320

Over 40 people enjoyed Bingo, prizes, bars, and the chocolate fountain at the annual Bingo Blitz and Soup Supper in Lynnville, Friday night, Mar. 8, in the basement of 1st State Bank’s Lynnville branch. Donations totaled $1,320, including a $1,000 donation from 1st State Bank. Kyle Terpstra and Brad Van Vark called out the Bingo and...

Dreaming of gardening goodness

By Megan Pothoven Can you believe the weather we have had so far this year? With the warm temperatures, it has caused me to start thinking about gardening. I did not think I would already be thinking about it, but it’s impossible when we can go for a walk so comfortably this early in the year. Something...

City of Sully leases ice cream shoppe and concession stand to Bloms

Sully City Council met in regular session at 7 p.m., Monday, Mar. 11, at Sully Community Center. Present were mayor Ben Ahrens, city clerk Barbra Maasdam, public works director Jeremy Behun, councilmembers MaryCarol Cross, Tim LeCompte, Dan Stouthammer, Justin Van Soelen, and Jon Van Wyk. Public could participate via electronic means. Guests present were Jasper...

City of Lynnville preparing for Highway 146 detour slated to begin in May

Lynnville City Council met at 5:30 p.m., Monday, Mar. 11, at Lynnville City Hall. Mayor Mark Newberg called the meeting to order with councilmembers Bailey Tompkins, Bev Van Maanen, Terry Fraker, and Terry Needham present and Tanis Comegys absent. City clerk Bev Arthur and city maintenance director Nick Arthur were also present. Guests included Brad...

Nira Johnson Wilkinson, 97

Services honoring Nira Johnson Wilkinson, 97, of Mountain Home, AR, took place at Kirby Family Funeral Home Chapel in Mountain Home, AR, at 2 p.m., Saturday, Mar. 9, 2024. A graveside service at West Liberty Cemetery in Searsboro was at 10 a.m., Tuesday, Mar. 12. As we bid farewell to Nira Wilkinson's earthly presence, we...
